questions.question: Which of the following are the top three causes of the French Revolution?

choices.answer: Grain Shortage, Estates General Issues, & Prison Riots
Prison Riots, Social Inequalities, & Enlightenment Ideas
Social Inequalities, Economic Trouble, & Enlightenment Ideas

questions.question: What did the members of the National Assembly swear during the Tennis Court Oath?

choices.answer: They would overthrow the monarchy before their next meeting.
They would preserve the monarchy for King Louis XVI.
They would start a revolution before sundown.

questions.question: Which of the following occurred during the Moderate Phase of the French Revolution?

choices.answer: The National Assembly beheaded King Louis XVI.
The National Assembly created an absolute monarchy.
The National Assembly stormed the Bastille.
The National Assembly created a constitutional monarchy.

questions.question: What happened to the royal family after the Women's March on Versailles?

choices.answer: They were compelled to return to Paris with the crowd.
They stayed in the Palace of Versailles.
They successfully got the crowd to leave them alone.
They were forced to admit they were hiding grain.

questions.question: What did the radicals do once they took over the Legislative Assembly?

choices.answer: abolished the French Republic and created a monarchy
abolished the monarchy and established the French Republic

questions.question: What was the fate of Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette?

choices.answer: Marie Antoinette died of illness while Louis XVI was killed.
They were both beheaded within months of one another.
Marie Antoinette was beheaded and Louis XVI was spared.

questions.question: What happened to the famous Jacobin, Jean-Paul Marat?

choices.answer: He was killed by Robespierre and the radicals.
His life was spared as he was a royalist sympathizer.
He was killed by Charlotte Corday, a royalist sympathizer.

He is mocked after his suicide attempt.

questions.question: How was The Directory (government after the Radical Phase) overthrown?

choices.answer: Napoleon stages a coup d'etat when the Directory is weak.
A crowd of 2000 men killed the five-man government.
Napoleon killed every member of the failed government.
